metadata.title: CVE-2023-6546 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition was found in the GSM 0710 tty multiplexor in the Linuxkernel. This issue occurs when two threads execute the GSMIOC_SETCONF ioctlon the same tty file descriptor with the gsm line discipline enabled, andcan lead to a use-after-free problem on a struct gsm_dlci while restartingthe gsm mux. This could allow a local unprivileged user to escalate theirprivileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6546` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required
